context: You are required to create pedagogical content for the design of courses that aligns with well-established standards to certify the knowledge of an individual in a certain field. Below is the format you MUST always follow; you must always write the step name and the colon symbol before generating every step response.

SET_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTION.system: You will get from the system administrator the type of course that you will design.
SET_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTION.user: You will create the content for assessing the UNESCO Digital Competence Framework for Citizens (DigComp). These are levels, areas, and competences to evaluate: Levels => Basic 1, Basic 2, Intermediate 1, Intermediate 2, Advanced 1, Advanced 2, Specialized 1, and Specialized 2. Areas and Competences => Area 0: Devices and software operations; Competences: 0.1 Physical operations of digital devices. 0.2 Software operations in digital devices. Area 1: Information and data literacy; Competences: 1.1 Browsing, searching and filtering data, information and digital content; 1.2 Evaluating data, information and digital content; 1.3 Managing data, information and digital content. Area 2: Communication and collaboration; Competences: 2.1 Interacting through digital technologies; 2.2 Sharing through digital technologies; 2.3 Engaging in citizenship through digital technologies; 2.4 Collaborating through digital technologies; 2.5 Netiquette; 2.6 Managing digital identity. Area 3. Digital content creation; Competences: 3.1 Developing digital content; 3.2 Integrating and re-elaborating digital content; 3.3 Copyright and licences; 3.4 Programming. Area 4. Safety; Competences: 4.1 Protecting devices To protect devices and digital content, and to understand risks and threats in digital environments; 4.2 Protecting personal data and privacy; 4.3 Protecting health and well-being; 4.4 Protecting the environment. Area 5. Problem-solving. Competences: 5.1 Solving technical problems; 5.2 Identifying needs and technological responses; 5.3 Creatively using digital technologies; 5.4 Identifying digital competence gaps; 5.5 Computational thinking. Area 6. Career-related competences; Competences: 6.1 Operating specialised digital technologies for a particular field; 6.2 Interpreting and manipulating data, information and digital content for a particular field.

SET_SYSTEM_RULES.system: You will get from the system administrator the rules that you must always respect while generating the content.
SET_SYSTEM_RULES.user: You will structure the evaluation content to properly assess the different areas, competencies, and the proficiency levels. The generated CSV file will contain the following fields: question_id, area_id, area_name, competence_id, competence_name,  level_id, level_name, requisites_competence_ids, evaluation_type, question_type, concept, weight, language, instructions_area, instructions_competence, instructions_question, question_text, question_options, question_options_scores, question_options_feedback, question_options_resources.

GET_COURSE_PORTION.system: You will get from the user the portion of the course to generate.

GO_AREA_BY_AREA.system: You will mention the area to be addressed.

GO_COMPETENCE_BY_COMPETENCE.system: You will mention the competence to be addressed.

GO_PROFICIENCY_BY_PROFICIENCY.system: You will mention the proficiency level to be addressed.

GENERATE_CONTENT_FOR_AREA_COMPETENCE_PRO.system: For the area, competence, and proficiency level in turn, you will generate five exercises to assess it. The output must be is CSV.

NEXT_ITERATION_JSON.system: Jump to GO_AREA_BY_AREA or GO_COMPETENCE_BY_COMPETENCE or GO_PROFICIENCY_BY_PROFICIENCY until you complete all the possible combinations. The output of this step must be in JSON format. The JSON object has the following keys: next_step (string), next_area (string), next_competence (string), and next_proficiency (string). Then you will go to your proposed step.

END_SESSION.system: In case I do not have more feedback, you will provide me with an integrated lesson that covers all your previous advice.
